Section.Heading: Computing strongly Shoda pairs

Attr.Name: StronglyShodaPairs
Attr.Comm: A list of SSPs representatives realizing Wedderburn components of QG

ManSection.Returns: A list of pairs of subgroups of the input group
ManSection.Description: Computes a list ssp of representatives of the equivalence classes of strongly Shoda pairs of the finite group G (see ).

Section.Example: gap> StronglyShodaPairs( SymmetricGroup(4) ); [ [ Sym( [ 1 .. 4 ] ), Group([ (1,4)(2,3), (1,3)(2,4), (2,4,3), (3,4) ]) ], [ Sym( [ 1 .. 4 ] ), Group([ (1,4)(2,3), (1,3)(2,4), (2,4,3) ]) ], [ Group([ (3,4), (1,3,2,4) ]), Group([ (1,3,2,4), (1,2)(3,4) ]) ], [ Group([ (1,3,2,4), (3,4) ]), Group([ (3,4), (1,2)(3,4) ]) ], [ Group([ (2,4,3), (1,4)(2,3) ]), Group([ (1,4)(2,3), (1,3)(2,4) ]) ] ] gap> StronglyShodaPairs( DihedralGroup(64) ); [ [ <pc group of size 64 with 6 generators>, Group([ f6, f5, f4, f3, f1, f2 ]) ], [ <pc group of size 64 with 6 generators>, Group([ f6, f5, f4, f3, f1*f2 ]) ], [ <pc group of size 64 with 6 generators>, Group([ f6, f5, f4, f3, f2 ]) ], [ <pc group of size 64 with 6 generators>, Group([ f6, f5, f4, f3, f1 ]) ], [ Group([ f1*f2, f4*f5*f6, f5*f6, f6, f3, f3 ]), Group([ f6, f5, f4, f1*f2 ]) ], [ Group([ f6, f5, f2, f3, f4 ]), Group([ f6, f5 ]) ], [ Group([ f6, f2, f3, f4, f5 ]), Group([ f6 ]) ], [ Group([ f2, f3, f4, f5, f6 ]), Group([ ]) ] ]

Section.Label: IsSSP
Section.Heading: Properties related with Shoda pairs

Oper.Name: IsStronglyShodaPair
Oper.Comm: Is (K,H) a strongly Shoda pair of G?

ManSection.Description: Returns true if (K,H) is a strongly Shoda pair of the group G, and false otherwise (see for the definition).

Oper.Name: IsShodaPair
Oper.Comm: Is (K,H) a Shoda pair of G?

ManSection.Description: Returns true if (K,H) is a Shoda pair of the group G, and false otherwise (see for the definition). Note that every strongly Shoda pair is a Shoda pair, but the converse is not true.

Oper.Name: IsStronglyMonomial
Oper.Comm: Is every Wedderburn component realizable by a SSP

ManSection.Description:
Returns true if the finite group G is strongly monomial, that is if every Wedderburn component of the rational group algebra is realizable by a strongly Shoda pair (see ). In this case also every Wedderburn component of a semisimple finite group algebra over G is also realizable by a strongly Shoda pair together with a cyclotomic class (see ).
Note that every strongly monomial finite group is monomial, and every abelian-by-supersolvable or metabelian finite group is strongly monomial. Also every monomial group of order less than 1000 is strongly monomial, but not every monomial group is strongly monomial.
